items.title: Policy paper: UK Emissions Trading Scheme (UK ETS): policy overview
items.summary: The role of the UK Emissions Trading Scheme in UK decarbonisation and how the UK ETS Authority is developing the scheme.

items.title: Statutory guidance: Reference Documents for The Customs Tariff (Preferential Trade Arrangements) (EU Exit) Regulations 2020
items.summary: Find the UK’s preferential tariffs and Rules of Origin for the agreements contained within the Customs Tariff (Preferential Trade Arrangements and Tariff Quotas) (Amendment) (EU Exit) Regulations 2020.

items.title: Notice: Trade remedies notices: registration of imports of boom lifts originating from China
items.summary: Trade remedies notice published by the Secretary of State for Business and Trade relating to the registration of imports of boom lifts originating from China.

items.title: Guidance: Capacity Market: appeals process
items.summary: Guidance on appeals process for capacity providers with a capacity agreement or a conditional capacity agreement.

items.title: Policy paper: UK-Indonesia Economic Growth Partnership
items.summary: The Economic Growth Partnership (EGP) sets out the UK and Indonesia’s shared priorities for trade, investment and economic cooperation.

items.title: Accredited official statistics: Weekly road fuel prices
items.summary: Road fuel price statistics providing average UK retail 'pump' prices on a weekly basis.

items.title: Update on the Government’s plans for audit reform legislation
items.summary: Letter from the Minister for Small Business and Economic Transformation to the Chair of the Business and Trade Committee on the Government's plans for audit reform legislation.

items.title: Strategy to boost UK education abroad in major £40bn growth drive
items.summary: Bold new strategy will grow education exports to £40bn a year by 2030, supporting UK jobs and investment.

items.title: Business Secretary backs British scaleups with growth package and red tape review
items.summary: British entrepreneurs, workers and communities will benefit from a sweeping package of growth measures, as the Government acts to invest in key growth sectors and slash red tape to help businesses scale up.

items.title: Policy paper: The UK's International Education Strategy 2026
items.summary: Strategy setting out the government’s plans for UK international education and how it will support the sector access global opportunities.

items.title: Refining our competition regime
items.summary: We are seeking views on measures to improve the pace,  predictability, proportionality and process of the UK’s competition regime.

items.title: Trade Envoy programme appointments
items.summary: The Secretary of State for Business and Trade has announced the appointment of five new UK Trade Envoys.

items.title: Policy paper: EM on power supply ecodesign requirements (C(2025)6759 & 7938)
items.summary: The Government's summary of a European Commission Regulation laying down ecodesign requirements for various power supplies, chargers, charging pads and cables.

items.title: £6 million repaid to workers as Government cracks down on employers underpaying their staff
items.summary: Nearly 500 employers fined over £10 million for failing to pay the National Minimum Wage

items.title: Guidance: UK ETS: Activity level report template
items.summary: For operators to use to submit activity level reports to their regulator.

items.title: Guidance: Training on export control compliance
items.summary: Courses, seminars, workshops and webinars to help exporters understand their obligations under export control legislation.

items.title: Guidance: Capture Redress Scheme: independent panel assessment framework
items.summary: The independent panel assessment framework ensures fair and consistent assessment of claims from postmasters affected by Capture-related shortfalls between 1992 and 2000.

items.title: Research: UK Offshore Energy Strategic Environmental Assessment: research
items.summary: Final reports for research projects commissioned as part of the UK Offshore Energy Strategic Environmental Assessment programme.

items.title: Carbon capture, usage and storage (CCUS): Ensuring fair access to CO2 infrastructure
items.summary: We are seeking views on the Storage of Carbon Dioxide (Access to Infrastructure) Regulations 2011 to ensure fair access to CO2 pipelines and storage sites.

items.title: Guidance: Changes to rules of origin under the Developing Countries Trading Scheme (DCTS)
items.summary: This guidance provides the technical detail of improvements to rules of origin under the Developing Countries Trading Scheme (DCTS).

items.title: Guidance: Country Graduation from the Developing Countries Trading Scheme: Indonesia
items.summary: This notice sets out the upcoming country graduation of Indonesia from the Developing Countries Trading Scheme(DCTS).

items.title: Guidance: Rules of origin changes under the Developing Countries Trading Scheme are now in effect
items.summary: This guidance explains improvements to the Developing Countries Trading Scheme (DCTS) rules of origin announced in July 2025.

items.title: Oil and gas: environmental submissions and determinations
items.summary: Interested parties can review records of applications and statements submitted to OPRED as required by environmental regulations.

items.title: Oil and gas: offshore environmental legislation
items.summary: Environmental regulations and guidance on offshore oil and gas exploration and production offshore gas unloading and storage and offshore carbon dioxide storage activities

items.title: Standard: UK Low Carbon Hydrogen Standard
items.summary: The UK Low Carbon Hydrogen Standard for hydrogen producers to use for greenhouse gas emissions reporting, including a calculator tool.

items.title: Heat Networks Delivery Unit
items.summary: Support and guidance for local authorities developing heat networks.

items.title: Guidance: Business Support Service: privacy notice
items.summary: How the Department for Business and Trade (DBT) will use your personal data when you contact the Business Support Service, and what your rights are.

items.title: Late payments: tackling poor payment practices
items.summary: We are seeking views on legislative measures which address late, long and disputed business-to-business payments, and the use of retention clauses in construction contracts.

items.title: Corporate report: Independent Commission for Aid Impact's review of UK aid for international energy transitions: UK government response
items.summary: The UK government response to the Independent Commission for Aid Impact's review of UK aid for international energy transitions.

items.title: Guidance: Designated standards: lifts
items.summary: Notices of publication and a consolidated list for designated standards for lifts.

items.title: UK marks first anniversary of 100 Year Partnership in Kyiv with new backing for reform and reconstruction
items.summary: The UK is stepping up its support for Ukraine as both countries mark the first anniversary of the landmark 100 Year Partnership.

items.title: Research: Retained EU law and assimilated law dashboard
items.summary: This dashboard shows a list of retained EU law (REUL) and assimilated law. These are laws that the UK saved to ensure legislative continuity immediately after Brexit.
